security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document is a collection of payroll authorization forms and memoranda related to staff employed by the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), primarily focusing on Nancy P. Schultz. It includes details of her employment history, salary adjustments, and certifications related to congressional relationships.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents primarily concerns Nancy P. Schultz's employment with the HSCA, encompassing payroll authorization forms that detail her appointments, salary adjustments, and eventual termination, alongside memoranda regarding staff payroll certifications and the hiring of secretaries within the HSCA. These forms, authorized by Louis Stokes, provide insights into Schultz's progression from a $12,000 salary in May 1977 to $16,700 by November 1978, as well as administrative procedures within the HSCA concerning payroll and staff relationships with members of Congress, all while redacting social security numbers for privacy reasons.
title: HSCA Staff Payroll Records
